posts.name: Elaine
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.90 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes:

  • Additional interface improvements, including an updated layout and Liquid Glass playback controls in the media viewer.

Backups is now available in production as well as TestFlight, but your early feedback is still crucial for us as we roll this out to a broader audience.

Please continue to report any issues you encounter!

When reporting issues, please include debug logs and screenshots if applicable; if you’re experiencing a crash, please also include .ips files. Instructions can be found here.

Thank you all, as always, for helping us improve Signal!
Previous beta: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.89 release - #13 by MaryArciniega

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.89 release

posts.name: Mary Arciniega
posts.cooked:
It appears I come to you only with visual glitches. Sorry….

I’ve found this issue today, on my iOS 26 iPhone. I’m not sure, but maybe Apple provided some APIs for that header to switch the text color based on the object that is under it?

Under it was a photo, that by coincidence, at that point was black. An the text header was also black. And this was the result:

IMG_02401164×288 176 KB

posts.name: Mary Arciniega
posts.cooked:
Actually, one more thing, as the old man used to say.

Remember the rounded corners of the chat list selection, that I’ve raised a couple of betas ago?

They are rounded now, but a strange thing keeps happening. Sometimes when I open the app, they are back to square, with no paddings, filling the entire area, left to right. If I go to portrait mode, they are back rounded. And if I go back to landscape again, they remain rounded for good. I’ve attached some screenshots.

Happy holidays!

First:

IMG_00232266×1488 57.7 KB

Second:

IMG_00241488×2266 62.9 KB

Third:

IMG_00252266×1488 69.3 KB

PS. This is on my iPad Mini, iPadOS 26. I don’t know if this is can be reproduced on the bigger iPads, since on that, I am still on iPadOS 18.

Automatic backup didn’t run in the background tonight and the night before

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.90.0/e463a2d53062b864c97c84a7fc2735361fba2e38faa1706a953f529d9408f72d.zip

posts.name: Mary Arciniega
posts.cooked:
Are there any issues with Signal not freeing the storage after a conversation is cleared? As an obssesed person that I am, for the new year I’ve just cleared all my conversations from Signal app on my iPad (I think this is important). Those conversations were also removed from my iPhone (as expected), but if I go and take a look at my iPhone settings, the storage Signal takes on my iPhone is stil 2GB. On my iPad, were the cleaning action originated, it looks fine, 71MB.

The only way I could free up the space on my iPhone was to remove the app and install it again.

iOS Signal crashed when I tried to transfer my chats to a newly linked desktop app image beta installation

iOS: https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.90.0/d9f4b95b7e2af11c73960a4465c1607bfec6456bb61e8f4add8f4d76a05701f6.zip

Desktop:
https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.84.0-beta.2/0446ff4a8a075f9525471b66ec6472055a7956d59b3968e7bf00ddbbebd69d16.gz

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: On the iPad, if you enter a groups settings and tap on someone from the members list, the window that shows up with info about actions you can take on the member is broken.

posts.name: Mary Arciniega
posts.cooked: True. And just to add more context to what you’ve said, this happens for me only on landscape mode. If I rotate my iPad to portrait mode, that modal is displayed correctly and it stays that way if I go back to landscape again. If I’m in portrait mode when I initiate the action of opening it, everything works and looks fine.

posts.name: Mary Arciniega
posts.cooked:
Damn, me again.

This situation is creeping up each time I use my iPad with iPadOS 18 on it and I use Signal in Slide Over mode. As you can see, the keybord cuts the application and the message inupt field, a bit.
